results.title: A Safe place
results.creator_credit: Anne Whitehead, Tasmanian Film Corporation and Robyn Cooney
results.brief_description: The prevention of child accidents in the home. Begins in the hospital, with the treatment of children in accidents, then broadens to a general look at the development of children in the first few years of growth, their capabilities, and perception of their environment, and potential for accident situations. Looks at ways of reducing risks to create a safe home environment.

results.title: The Lost 600
results.creator_credit: Michael Robertson, New South Wales. Dept. of Sport and Recreation and Michael Robertson Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Safety in, on and near the water”.
Emphasises the dangers associated with foolish, unsafe and reckless behaviour in and on the water. Among the many aspects of water safety covered are still-water drownings, surf safety, boating, yachting, water skiing, rock fishing and home pools.

results.title: Life Minus 3
results.brief_description: A film for the layperson on emergency procedures should someone have a sudden heart attack. If the heart stops beating, brain cells will die after three minutes. During this three minute period it is vital that life be prolonged by heart-lung and mouth to mouth resuscitation until expert aid arrives.
results.description: A film for the layperson on emergency procedures should someone have a sudden heart attack. If the heart stops beating, brain cells will die after three minutes. results.title: Hockey one hockey two
results.brief_description: Former Australian International Hockey player Margaret Pierce demonstrates basic skills. In this film Margaret demonstrates the three types of dribbling in Hockey-close, loose and Indian. Aimed at the beginner to intermediate hockey students to improve their skills

results.title: Eat, drink and be wary
results.brief_description: This film examines some of the problems associated with modern man’s increased reliance on manufactured and processed foods. Discusses the issues of additives, food processing, and the changes taking place in the American diet

results.title: Capricorn charter
results.creator_credit: Frank Killian, Queensland Government Tourist Bureau and Movietone Productions
results.brief_description: Shows the tourist features of the central coast of Queensland, with scenes around Rockhampton, Heron, Great Keppel and Quoin Islands, Yeppoon, Emu Park, Gladstone, Emerald and the Mount Morgan Mines.

results.title: Trapper Murphy
results.creator_credit: Ronald Mason and Academy Film Productions
results.brief_description:
Describes the menace to sheep of dingoes and foxes in the Bogong High Plains in Victoria and shows something of the way in which they are being exterminated. Includes a shot of dingoes actually killing sheep at night.

Please be advised: this film includes scenes of animals being hunted and destroyed which may be distressing to viewers.

results.title: Water for life and living
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Thompson and Cine Service Productions
results.brief_description: The recreational facilities established by the Melbourne and Metropolitan Board of Works around its reservoirs through its beautification program provide ideal surroundings for picnickers and the film shows the attraction provided, as well as some stages of construction of the Cardinia Reservoir. Narrated by Geoff Raymond.

results.title: For the love of a child
results.creator_credit: Douglas Stanley and Nomad Films International
results.brief_description: This film explores and examines natural childbirth and how it is being accepted. The film shows a Childbirth Education Class at work. These classes are teaching women to understand and control what is happening to their bodies during childbirth, and it involves fathers to be.

results.title: Focus on Ageing (TEFC)
results.brief_description: A recording of a discussion panel at Rusden State College with four active elderly people. Issues discussed included the structuring of time, community involvement, adjustment to retirement homes, attitudes to death and the art of ageing
